subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Lexical sets in groups
msgSnippet: ... Probably lots of accents on both sides.  I think we have to make an arbitrary choice here, and I d argue that Read has already made that choice at the
messageBody:
Ted Larson Freeman scripsit:

> Regarding Choice 1 vs. Choice 2, I could be persuaded in either
> direction. I guess the important question is this: is there any accent
> for which one of these choices would seem extremely unnatural?

Probably lots of accents on both sides. I think we have to make an
arbitrary choice here, and I'd argue that Read has already made
that choice at the bottom of the alphabet page, where he says to write
"air" (i.e. SQUARE) words with Eat.

But someone should go through QM and look at NEAR, SQUARE, and CURE
words to see what he does.

--
So that's the tune they play on John Cowan
their fascist banjos, is it? cowan@...
--Great-Souled Sam http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
